items.title: Wintertransfers Eredivisie seizoen 2025/26: alle clubs op een rij
items.summary: De transferperiode is weer losgebarsten. In dit overzicht van VI vind je alle afgeronde, door clubs bevestigde, wintertransfers van de achttien Eredivisie-clubs. Clubs in Nederland kunnen tot en met 2 februari spelers aantrekken .

items.title: Beuker legt uit waarom Ajax Ibrahimovic heeft gehaald
items.summary: Marijn Beuker is enthousiast over het binnenhalen van Maximilian Ibrahimovic . Ajax neemt de aanvaller op huurbasis over van AC Milan en heeft een optie tot koop bedongen. Volgens Beuker heeft de zoon van Zlatan Ibrahimovic de potentie om een vaste waarde in het eerste te worden.

items.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
items.summary: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

items.title: Sources: Utd not planning Jan. transfers for Carrick
items.summary: Michael Carrick will work with the squad he has inherited as Man United boss with the club having no plans to make new signings, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Pep rants over VAR on disallowed Semenyo goal
items.summary: Pep Guardiola said he expects an explanation from referees' chief Howard Webb during a post-match rant after Antoine Semenyo's disallowed goal during a Manchester City win over Newcastle United on Tuesday.

items.title: Rosenior plans talks with Chelsea exile Sterling
items.summary: \Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior said he intends to hold talks with Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi over their futures Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Klopp: Xabi's Madrid exit 'nothing to do with me'
items.summary: JÃ¼rgen Klopp has stated that he has not received any calls from Real Madrid following the exit of Xabi Alonso, and affirmed that the decision has nothing to do with him.

items.title: Could Arsenal win Premier League without a regular goalscorer?
items.summary: No team has ever won the Premier League title without having a player in the top 10 goalscorers, but could Arsenal change that?

items.title: Gesprekken tussen Malen en AS Roma over wintertransfer verlopen positief
items.summary: De mogelijke transfer van Donyell Malen naar AS Roma is weer een stap dichterbij gekomen. De aanvaller van Aston Villa staat open voor een avontuur in de Serie A en is na het akkoord tussen beide clubs in gesprek met de Italianen. Volgens ingewijden verlopen de onderhandelingen constructief.

items.title: In de voetsporen van zijn vader: Ajax presenteert Maximilian Ibrahimovic
items.summary: Ajax heeft de komst van Maximilian Ibrahimovic afgerond. De negentienjarige aanvaller, de zoon van Zlatan Ibrahimovic, wordt tot het einde van het seizoen gehuurd van AC Milan. Ajax heeft vervolgens de mogelijkheid om Ibrahimovic te kopen.

items.title: Engelse media bejubelen de 'beste beslissing die Man Utd had kunnen nemen'
items.summary: De Engelse media hebben vertrouwen in de aanstelling van Michael Carrick als manager van Manchester United. Hij maakt het seizoen af na het ontslag van RÃºben Amorim. Zij zagen hem de strijd winnen van Ole Gunnar Solskjaer. 'Ze hebben de verleiding weerstaan â€‹â€‹om te veel nostalgisch te worden.'

items.title: The Knowledge | Which football teams have scored after being reduced to eight players?
items.summary: Plus: high-ranking nations where Ballon dâ€™Or winners have never played and an own-goal scoring hat-trick hero Mail us with your questions and answers â€œLast month, Lazio scored a late winner (in the 82nd minute) against Parma despite having two players sent off earlier in the game,â€ writes Bogdan Kotarlic. â€œI wonder if any team has scored a goal (or maybe more) with eight players and with three players receiving red cards before that?â€ Thereâ€™s only one place to start: Boghead Park, Dumbarton. â€œIn August 1991, Premier Division Airdrieonians played Dumbarton in the Scottish League Cup,â€ writes Bill Hall. â€œWhat looked like an innocuous tie was anything but - especially for Dumbartonâ€™s Colin McNair, Stephen Gow and Jimmy Gilmour, who were shown red cards in what must have been a bad-tempered affair (I was there but it was 34 years ago, and I was in the pub beforehand, so memories are a bit vague). Continue reading...

items.summary: We have a busy dayâ€™s racing on Wednesday with action from Lingfield, Newbury and Happy Valley, live on Sky Sports Racing...

items.title: Maye vs the monster - why the Texans can shock the NFL
items.summary: Modern NFL defenses tend to like a scalpel. The Houston Texans prefer a sledgehammer.

items.title: Why has no English boss won Premier League - and who could be first?
items.summary: Why has an English manager not won the Premier League? Chief football writer Phil McNulty explores who could make history.

items.title: Raducanu fights back in Hobart to win first match since September
items.summary: Emma Raducanu earned her first victory since September after fighting back to beat Camila Osorio in straight sets in the first round of the Hobart International.

items.title: Semenyo scores again - who are winners and losers of his arrival?
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo has taken to life seamlessly at Manchester City by hitting the ground running and is already beginning to repay the Â£62.5m fee Pep Guardiola handed to Bournemouth to sign him.

items.title: The three ages of Michael Carrick â€¦ and what they say about Manchester United
items.summary: From his competitive debut to his first spell as interim, the former midfielder has seen much at Old Trafford over the past two decades 23 August 2006, Charlton 0-3 Manchester United The 25â€‘yearâ€‘old new signing was eased into Unitedâ€™s midfield as a second-half substitute in the second game of the season, having picked up a small injury on the preâ€‘season tour. With Wayne Rooney and Paul Scholes suspended, Sir Alex Ferguson started with John Oâ€™Shea and Darren Fletcher in central midfield, with the Scot (sporting a mullet) opening the scoring after Ryan Giggs and Cristiano Ronaldo had hit the woodwork. Carrick was one of four future United managers in the side, alongside Fletcher, Giggs and Ole Gunnar SolskjÃ¦r, who rounded off the win with a late goal after Louis Saha had doubled Unitedâ€™s lead. SolskjÃ¦râ€™s goal was his first in the league in three injury-hit years, and the Norwegian, also a substitute, should have had another when Carrick squared a perfect pass to the striker, only for Charltonâ€™s Scott Carson to make an outstanding save. With Carrick an instant success at United that season, the club roared to the title in May 2007, their first in four years. Continue reading...

items.title: â€˜VAR delay made us strongerâ€™: Guardiola hails City after disallowed Semenyo goal
items.summary: â€˜I think my players were angry. The spirit was thereâ€™ Newcastle beaten 2-0 in Carabao Cup semi-final first-leg Pep Guardiolaâ€™s evident delight at Manchester Cityâ€™s 2-0 win at Newcastle in the first leg of their Carabao Cup semi-final was tempered by the lengthy video assistant referee delay that disallowed what would have been Antoine Semenyoâ€™s second goal of the game. It prompted Manchester Cityâ€™s manager to launch into an epic, and often incomprehensible, rant about VAR and its perceived failings or, more pertinently, non-involvements during Cityâ€™s 2-1 defeat at Newcastle in November and last seasonâ€™s FA Cup final defeat to Crystal Palace. Continue reading...

items.title: 'The game has gone' - a bad night for VAR in semi-final
items.summary: Manchester City's 2-0 win over Newcastle in the first leg of the Carabao Cup semi-final was overshadowed by a contentious decision to disallow a goal from Antoine Semenyo in the second half.
